Bent Over Rows: 3 sets of 8-10 repetiti: Core Exercises: 15 minutes of chose 2: Planks; Russian Twists; Bicycle Crunche; Leg Raises or  Crunches

Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 repetition: Bent Over Rows: 3 sets of 8-10 repetitions

Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-10 repetitions: Choose your favorite cardio machine (treadmill; elliptical; stationary bike; rowing machine; etc.) and perform steady-state cardio for 45 minutes
Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 8-10 repetiti: Russian Twists: 3 sets of 12-15 repetitions (each side)
Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 repetition: Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 12-15 repetitions (each side)

Bent Over Rows: 3 sets of 8-10 repetiti: Single Leg Stance: Stand behind a sturdy chair and hold onto it for support. Lift one foot off the ground and balance on the other foot for 10-15 seconds. Repeat on the other side
Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 8-10 repetiti: Heel-to-Toe Walk: Take small steps forward placing the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot. Walk in a straight line for a few steps then turn around and walk back Tandem Stance: Stand with one foot directly in front of the other - heel to toe - like walking on a tightrope. Hold this position for 10-15 seconds then switch sides
Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 repetition: Clock Reach: Stand on one leg and extend the opposite leg behind you. Reach both arms forward then slowly reach one arm to the side then overhead and finally to the ground while maintaining balance. Return to the starting position and switch legs
Tricep Dips: 3 sets of 10-12 repetition: Seated Forward Bend: Sit on the edge of a chair with your feet flat on the floor. Hinge at the hips and lean forward reaching your hands towards your feet. Hold for 15-30 seconds then slowly return to an upright position
Neck Stretch: Sit tall in a chair and gently tilt your head to one side bringing your ear towards your shoulder. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch sides
column9: Seated Spinal Twist: Sit on a chair with your feet flat on the floor. Twist your torso to one side placing one hand on the opposite knee and the other hand on the back of the chair for support. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch sides
column10: Hip Flexor Stretch: Stand behind a chair and hold onto it for support. Take a step back with one foot and bend your front knee lowering into a lunge position. Keep your back knee straight and gently push your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of your hip. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch sides

Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-10 repetitions: Take a break and allow your body to recover fully. Focus on relaxation and activities that promote mental well-being
